channel.title: Lab News on The Niederhuth Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Lab News on The Niederhuth Lab

item.title: The Niederhuth Lab is open!
item.description: The lab is now officially started at MSU. The future lab space and office is currently still undergoing remodeling and at the moment I am working out of Dr. Doug Schemske’s former lab space. Lot of history here and I am happy to have joined a wonderful group of colleagues and a vibrant plant biology community. date: 2018-01-08T16:11:22-05:00

item.title: Coming Soon to MSU
item.description: I’m happy to say that the Niederhuth Lab will be starting at Michigan State University in the Department of Plant Biology on January 1, 2018. Our research focuses on plant genomics and epigenomics using both experimental and computational approaches. If you are interested in joining the lab, please check our current openings! date: 2017-10-20T12:38:43-07:00
